intro: Hibiscus caerulescens var. bevilanyensis, commonly known as the Bevilanyensis hibiscus, is a rare and flowering plant native to specific regions in Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in montane forests. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers have five petals with a prominent central stigma. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
